comments:
OS : RHEL 3.1
Must fix : YES
Build date: 0614 

launch the Agent Controller :
./RAStart.sh

Start Eclipse
Select Window->Open Perspective->Other->Profiling and Logging
In the Run menu, select Profile
Double click on the Statistical label in the Configuration list on the left of the dialog
Click on the Agent tab
Select the Linux System Trace agent from the list
Click on the Profile button. The Profiling Monitor will get populated with a new Perfmon Agent
Select the Linux Agent in the Profiling Monitor and click on the Start Monitoring button
The Linux agent should change to a monitoring state
Right-click on it and choose Open With -> Agent Control
In the Agent Control tab, expand the LinuxAgent

Problem Description:

Several error messages appear, then you can see that the different Categories (see first screencapture) are missing Labels and that all the monitored actions names are missing too (see second screencapture).
NOTE: this is not a translation problem. It happends on English build too. I used tptp.sdk-TPTP-4.2.0-200606141224.zip

You start RAC before starting Eclipse, so this should guarantee going through RAC and not IAC. Still, I would feel better if you explicitly confirmed that (1) in the Hosts tab you're seeing/setting some host info, and (2) you run the "Test Connection" and get success there to the host. Is nls259.rtp.raleigh.ibm.com the localhost? or are you going to it remote but didn't note that part of the setup?

Also, the error messages refer to the logfile... can you give us what the logfile is saying so we know if there is some dependency missing that we've not specified?

This "works for me", but then I'm testing on openSUSE 10, not RHEL 3.1, and with all of Callisto installed, not just our stated dependencies. Once I know if your case is localhost or remote I can figure out if I can test this on RHEL 3.1 remote (easy) or local (more difficult for me... it's a lab machine).

According to Duncan.Doyle@gmail.com (from an e-mail I just received):

Anthony, this is a translation issue, not an agent issue. The statistical views translate tokens sent back by the statistical agents so that the descriptor tree can be translated in the control and summaries views. The issue you are seeing is that there is no translation string available, hence it returns null.

So only non translated strings are visible. The translation map attempts to gather translated values for tokens from the default translation framework, so if it doesn't work in one language for you then it will not work in any.

Is this still present in the GA build?
I completely reinstalled Eclipse WTP (the newest Eclipse Build with seperate WTP plugins) and TPTP build TPTP-4.2.1-200607032033. I still get the same error.
all the testers are gone. We don't have the resource to try that. You may download the NL packs from Eclipse download site. Thanks.
Hi, I have encountered the same problem too. What are the NL packs? Are those the Natural Language packs? If so, how would it help the problem? Thanks.

(In reply to comment #8)
> Hi, I have encountered the same problem too. What are the NL packs? Are those
> the Natural Language packs? If so, how would it help the problem? Thanks.
> 

NL packs are national language packs (such as Chinese, Japanese) that we translate eclipse into. 
But this problem is not happening in 3.2.1 anymore. So I am changing this one to worksforme.

Created an attachment (id=47713)
Works for me in 3.2.1

Just a note in case someone runs into this one again... I just ran into the same problem based on running a 4.3 release candidate AC (and associated, including the all-important LinuxAgent) when monitoring from an Eclipse with a 4.2 TPTP runtime installed. Gotta keep the TPTP runtime and the AC/agents synced up.
